definition: (slang) to rely on one's father's wealth or prestige to get ahead
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
children of officials/word created by analogy with 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
those who did not benefit from the Chinese economic reforms of the 1980s/see also 富二代[fu4 er4 dai4]
children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
(coll.) to live with and depend on one's parents even upon reaching adulthood
to live off a rich man
favoritism shown to sb because of the influence of the person's wife or other female relative/(by extension) favoritism towards relatives, friends or associates
(coll.) adults still living with and depending on their parents
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
higher education record/record including Master's or Doctoral degree
high in score but low in ability (as a result of teaching to the test)
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
one who is successful in one's studies, can become an official (idiom)
